00030  * -------------------------------------------------------------- create segment - function --
00031  */
00032 
00050 data_collect createSegment(int shm_size, int shm_mode) {
00051     data_collect ret_object;
00052         int shm_flag = 0;
00053 
00054         /* default values */
00055         ret_object.shm_size = shm_size;
00056         ret_object.use_mode = shm_mode;
00057         ret_object.sem_r = -1;
00058         ret_object.sem_w = -1;
00059         ret_object.shmid = -1;
00060         ret_object.segment = NULL;
00061         
00062         /* ignore these signals: */
00063         signal(SIGINT, SIG_IGN);
00064         signal(SIGTERM, SIG_IGN);
00065         signal(SIGHUP, SIG_IGN);
00066         signal(SIGQUIT, SIG_IGN);
00067         
00068         /*  create segment: */
00069         if ((ret_object.shmid = shmget(SHM_KEY, sizeof(int) * ret_object.shm_size, 0660 | IPC_CREAT)) == -1) {
00070                 fprintf(stderr,"%s: %s\n", "shmget()", strerror(errno));
00071                 closeSegment(ret_object);
00072                 return ret_object;
00073     }
00074 
00075     /* attach to the segment to get a pointer to it: */
00076     if (ret_object.use_mode == READ_MODE) shm_flag = SHM_RDONLY;
00077         
00078     
00079     if ((ret_object.segment = shmat(ret_object.shmid, NULL, shm_flag)) == (char *)(-1)) {
00080                 fprintf(stderr,"%s: %s\n", "shmat()", strerror(errno));
00081                 closeSegment(ret_object);
00082         return ret_object;
00083     }
00084         
00085         /* read-semaphore don't exist, so initialize: */
00086         if ((ret_object.sem_r = seminit(SEM_R_KEY, 0600, 0)) == -1) {
00087                 if (errno == EEXIST) {
00088                         /* already created by other process */
00089                         if ((ret_object.sem_r = semgrab(SEM_R_KEY)) == -1) {
00090                                 fprintf(stderr,"%s: %s\n", "semgrab(sem_r)", strerror(errno));
00091                                 closeSegment(ret_object);
00092                                 return ret_object;
00093                         }
00094                 } else {
00095                         fprintf(stderr,"%s: %s\n", "seminit(sem_r)", strerror(errno));
00096                         closeSegment(ret_object);
00097                         return ret_object;
00098                 }
00099         }
00100 
00101         /* write-semaphore don't exist, so initialize: */
00102         if ((ret_object.sem_w = seminit(SEM_W_KEY, 0600, ret_object.shm_size)) == -1) {
00103                 if (errno == EEXIST) {
00104                         /* already created by other process */
00105                         if ((ret_object.sem_w = semgrab(SEM_W_KEY)) == -1) {
00106                                 fprintf(stderr,"%s: %s\n", "semgrab(sem_w)", strerror(errno));
00107                                 closeSegment(ret_object);
00108                                 return ret_object;
00109                         }
00110                 } else {
00111                         fprintf(stderr,"%s: %s\n", "seminit(sem_w)", strerror(errno));
00112                         closeSegment(ret_object);
00113                         return ret_object;
00114                 }
00115         }
00116         
00117         return ret_object;
00118 }

00120 /*
00121  * -------------------------------------------------------------- close segment - function --
00122  */
00123 
00140 int closeSegment(data_collect shm_sem) {
00141     int returnvalue = 0;
00142     
00143     /* clean up semaphores */
00144         if (shm_sem.sem_w != -1) {
00145                 if ((returnvalue = semrm(shm_sem.sem_w)) == -1) {
00146                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", "semrm(shm_sem.sem_w)", strerror(errno));
00147                         shm_sem.sem_w = -1;
00148                         return returnvalue;
00149                 }
00150         }
00151         
00152         if (shm_sem.sem_r != -1) {
00153                 if ((returnvalue = semrm(shm_sem.sem_r)) == -1) {
00154                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", "semrm(shm_sem.sem_r)", strerror(errno));
00155                         shm_sem.sem_r = -1;
00156                         return returnvalue;
00157                 }
00158         }
00159         
00160     /*  detach shared memory segment: */
00161         if (shm_sem.segment != NULL) {
00162                 if ((returnvalue = shmdt(shm_sem.segment)) == -1) {
00163                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", "shmdt()", strerror(errno));
00164                         shm_sem.segment = NULL;
00165                         return returnvalue;
00166                 }
00167                 shm_sem.segment = NULL;
00168         }
00169         
00170     /*  if shared memory segment exists mark as removable */
00171         if (shm_sem.shmid != -1) {
00172                 if ((returnvalue = shmctl(shm_sem.shmid, IPC_RMID, NULL)) == -1) {
00173                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", "shmctl()", strerror(errno));
00174                         shm_sem.shmid = -1;
00175                         return returnvalue;
00176                 } 
00177                 shm_sem.shmid = -1;
00178         }
00179 
00180     return returnvalue;
00181 }

00183 /*
00184  * -------------------------------------------------------------- parseParameter - function --
00185  */
00186 
00201 int parseParameter(int argc, char * argv[]) {
00202         int option;
00203         long int size = -1;
00204         char* prest = NULL;
00205 
00206         errno = 0;
00207 
00208         /* check parameter list for valid options */
00209         while ((option = getopt(argc, argv, "+m:")) != -1) {
00210                 switch (option) {
00211                         case 'm':
00212                                 /* convert buffer size string to numeric  */
00213                                 size = strtol(optarg, &prest, 10);
00214                                 if (errno != 0 || *prest != '\0' || size <= 0) {
00215                                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", "could not convert argument", strerror(errno));
00216                                         return -1;
00217                                 }
00218                                 break;
00219                                 
00220                         default:
00221                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: -%c.\n", "invalid option", option);
00222                                 return -1;
00223                 }
00224         }
00225 
00226         /* check for extra parameters */
00227         if (optind < argc) {
00228                 fprintf(stderr, "%s:\n", "illegal number of options");
00229                 return -1;
00230         }
00231 
00232         return (int) size;
00233 }
